intro: Hypochaeris gayana, commonly known as the yellow weed or golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils, and it is often found in temperate regions. Hypochaeris gayana produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, and it has a low-growing, herbaceous habit. It is also known for its ability to spread rapidly through seed dispersal, making it a common weed in many areas.
